intro: Buchenavia vaupesana, commonly known as the yellow-barked tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow bark and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Buchenavia vaupesana is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some parts of its native range.
